content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very good coding practice, was fun completing. The statement is very clear.
I have just deleted "Line 4:" in front of "Next M lines:".

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it may be a little more explicit, but kinda fun overall

First, correct the typo (exemple). Going on to the actual puzzle, it's simple enough to solve, don't know if it's better suited as a CoC or a classic puzzle. I did it quickly, but I use Python, so I'm kind of “cheating”. I'm curious to see what people come up with for the shortest mode, though.

Nice puzzle! Some comments:

* Do add [[]] and {{}} formatting to the statement section.

* When introducing "the first case," you should write "As an example, for test case 1" or some variation of that.

* The Output description doesn't need to have all the details since those are provided very explicitly in the main statement.

* I don't think you need to mention in the main text that two people can't occupy the same seat, but you should mention that in the constraints.
Change the constraint from 1≤ M to 0 ≤ M to match test 4.

1. Tests and validators should be different.

2. Please format all the variables in the Constraints section.

3. There is no "integer array". Suggest you to either change the line 4 input as space-separated integers, or change "line 4" as "Next [[M]] lines". In either case please change the wording of "integer array" to an appropriate description as well.

Thanks.
Thank you for this instructive feedback :)

It can be simpler with only N and K.
Using python is cheating ? :D
I'm curious to see how people solve it, I do not think I have the best solution

Yeah, I don't think I have the shortest either, it could be done for the fastest though. I put every occupied seat in a list and dump every seat in range K in a set. Check if a seat is occupied or in the “empty” set, and add it to occupied if it's not. Dump more seats in “empty” set, and finally print the occupied list's length, minus M.

Thank you. Suggest you to revise the 4th input description as follows:
<<Next [[M]] lines:>> An integer for the position of the seat occupied by a diner
(a few changes there, including that "diner" not "dinner"!)
